title: European intelligence services adapt to the upheavals of the Trump era
subhead: Shaken by Donald Trump's unpredictable behavior, European intelligence services, long reliant on the United States, are tightening their cooperation.

title: In Gaza, the fate of thousands missing remains unknown
Seif al-Islam Gaddafi, enigmatic son of the Libyan dictator, murdered in his mountain hideout
French far right's EU embezzlement was 'directed by' Le Pen, prosecutors argue
subhead: Prosecutors at Marine Le Pen's appeal trial requested a four-year prison sentence and a five-year ban on being elected to office for the far-right leader, describing her as 'the instigator, following her father, of a system that allowed her to embezzle €1.4 million.'

title: How France's lottery operator fuels the toxic online casino ecosystem in the Comoros
subhead: The Comorian island of Anjouan has gained a reputation as a haven for online casinos with illegal and harmful practices. Yet a subsidiary of Française des Jeux recently obtained a questionable license there to provide its iGaming services.

title: Italy says it stopped Russian-linked cyberattacks targeting 2026 Winter Olympics sites
subhead: Just hours before the first sporting events, Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani said Italy had foiled a series of Russian cyberattacks targeting foreign ministry offices and Winter Olympics sites, including hotels in Cortina.

title: Ukraine's 'grandfathers' go to war
subhead: The Ukrainian army has an average age of 45, significantly older than European standards. The draft has targeted men between the ages of 25 and 60, which contrasts with recruitment practices typically seen in Western countries.

Gabriella Papadakis, ice dancer: 'My mother turned me into a little soldier who let herself be guided by the decisions of others'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The figure skater and former Olympic champion looks back on a childhood filled with constraints in order to succeed in a demanding and conservative environment.

title: One month after Maduro's abduction in Venezuela, the transition of power is unclear
subhead: While Delcy Rodriguez, whom Donald Trump approved to replace Nicolas Maduro at the start of January, appears to be meeting Washington's expectations, it is still impossible to know whether this situation will open up space for democracy.

title: Blocking the Russian army: Ukraine's impossible mission
subhead: With limited technical and human resources, soldiers and engineers in these units, increasingly exposed to drone fire, are trying to contain the Russian army, which continues to make slow but steady advances.

title: The end of US-Russia nuclear treaty is a dangerous signal for deterrance
